titleStmt.title: A speech delivered by the right honourable VVilliam Lord Marquesse Hartford, in the councell-chamber at Oxford, to the Kings most Excellent Majesty, and the Lords of his Privie Councell, on Saturday Ianuary 14. 1642. Wherein he fully sets downe his opinion concerning the present warres, and an accomodation of peace between His Majesty and his high Court of Parliament.
titleStmt.author: Somerset, William Seymour, Duke of, 1588-1660.

titleStmt.title: A speech delivered by the right honourable VVilliam Lord Marquesse Hartford, in the councell-chamber at Oxford, to the Kings most Excellent Majesty, and the Lords of his Privie Councell, on Saturday Ianuary 14. 1642. Wherein he fully sets downe his opinion concerning the present warres, and an accomodation of peace between His Majesty and his high Court of Parliament.
titleStmt.author: Somerset, William Seymour, Duke of, 1588-1660.

notesStmt.note: An incentive to peace, and a plain warning to the King of the weakness of his adherents and army.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
